conversation.content: Let me see here... Card won't work. Hmm. Might've done something wrong.

Oh no worries at all, let's figure this out together! So I'm pulling up your account here—wait, sorry, need your member ID first—that's the MID number on your card, starts with MID-4 and then has like eight more digits after that.
Okay so... MID-4892-7736. Think I clicked something. Reset maybe?

Perfect, got it! Okay so between you and me? Half the calls I get are about this exact thing, and honestly—no wait, let me check something first—yep, I can see your password reset attempt from yesterday at 3:47 PM, and it looks like the system, er, didn't complete the verification step.
Knew it. My fault then. What now?

Actually no, not your fault at all! See, the verification email went to your old address ending in @hotmail—sorry, I mean, it should've gone to your gmail but the system still had your old one on file, so really that's on us.
Hmm, wait... How do I know this isn't... Never gave you my email.

Oh totally fair question! So I can see here your primary email on account ACC-7829-QM is the gmail one you updated in January, but for some reason the security settings—er, let me rephrase that—the password recovery still points to the hotmail from 2019.
Okay so that means... Still locked out though. Just need in.
Right right, absolutely.
Let me think... Is there a fee? For fixing whatever I broke?

Oh gosh no, absolutely not! Listen, I'm gonna let you in on something here—this happens literally dozens of times a day, and between you and me? It's a known glitch we haven't fixed yet, so what I'm gonna do is send you a priority reset link to SMS-7736, that's the number on file, and waive any verification holds.
That's... suspicious. How much info can you see exactly?

Mm, so I can see your last four transactions, your shipping address which is, uh, lemme check—1847 Pine Street, Unit B—and basically just what I need to verify identity and help with account stuff, nothing like, you know, nothing invasive or anything.
Hmm. Fine. Send it then. Hope this works.

Already sent! Should hit your phone in about, er, fifteen seconds—no wait, there it is, just went through at 2:47:32 PM, and once you click that link you'll get a temporary password that starts with TEMP- and then some random characters.
Got it. TEMP-QX9M-2K7L. Now what?
Perfect!
Still not working. Let me see... Oh. Caps lock. Never mind.

Happens to the best of us, seriously! Actually, while I have you—since this whole thing was basically our system being weird—I'm adding a courtesy credit of $15 to your account, reference number CRD-2024-8837-B, just as a sorry for the hassle, and I've updated your recovery email so this won't happen again.

scenario: embarrassed because they think they might have caused the problem themselves
